oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Check that Ubuntu LTS 14.04 is installed.

ind-def:family_test.comment: Test that the host is part of the unix family.

unix-def:uname_test.comment: Test that the host is part of the unix family.

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: This project provides prescriptive guidance for creating hardened, FISMA-Ready configurations for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS Server.
This rule selects all rules contained in this Benchmark that are generally applicable.

cdf12:Profile.cdf12:title: Select Rules for Vagrant Use Case

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: This rule selects all rules that are applicable to the Vagrant Use Case.

cdf12:Value.cdf12:title: Debian Binary Package Repository URI
cdf12:Value.cdf12:description: The value defines the URI for the Debian package repository which APT is configured to use.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Ensure Vagrant Guest Additions are Up-to-date

cdf12:description.xhtml:p: If you are doing this work via Vagrant, before you do your first vagrant up, you might have a version mistmatch between the Guest Additions installed on the box vs your install of VirtualBox.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: Go to the same folder as the Vagrantfile you're about to use:
cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code: vagrant plugin install vagrant-vbguest vagrant up

cdf12:Value.cdf12:title: Debian Binary Package Repository URI
cdf12:Value.cdf12:description: A regular expression to match against all debian repository URIs.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Ensure that Ubuntu is Up-to-date
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Ubuntu should be completely patched and up-to-date.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Ensure Partitions are Set Up Securely
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: The /run/shm, /tmp, /home, /var and /var/log/audit partitions should not reside on the same device as the system partition.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: See the Disk Partioning Guide in Hardening Ubuntu 14.04 to 18F standards.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Reduce Attack Surface
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Every installed application creates an potential attack surface. A hardened OS reduces this surface to the absolute minimum for system functionality.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: One of the places we can reduce the attack surface is in a configuration file stored in /etc/modprobe.d
cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code:
# Applications
install cramfs /bin/true install freevxfs /bin/true install jffs2 /bin/true install hfs /bin/true install hfsplus /bin/true install squashfs /bin/true install udf /bin/true
# Protocols
install dccp /bin/true install sctp /bin/true install rds /bin/true install tipc /bin/true

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Boot Loaders are Protected
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Boot loaders need to be protected. Anyone who is not root doesn't need to write to this file.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: grub Has a Bootloader Password
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: We don't want anyone messing with booting, so let's create a password.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code: grub-mkpasswd-pbkdf2 # keep password and encrypted version somewhere safe vim /etc/grub.d/40_custom
set superusers="INSERT USER HERE" password_pbkdf2 INSERT USER HERE <encrypted-password> EOF

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Harden ICMP Redirect Handling
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Unless this OS is powering a router, we can harden how it handles ICMP redirects.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: You'll find all the controls already here, but commented out. You'll want to remove the # for the following, or add these lines if they're not there:
cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code:
# Spoof protection net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter=1 net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter=1
# Do not accept ICMP redirects (prevent MITM attacks) net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects=0 net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_redirects=0 net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects=0 net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_redirects=0 net.ipv4.conf.all.secure_redirects=0 net.ipv4.conf.default.secure_redirects=0
# Do not send ICMP redirects (we are not a router) net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects=0 net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects=0
# Do not accept IP source route packets (we are not a router) net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route=0 net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route=0 net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route=0 net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route=0
# Log packets from Mars net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians=1 net.ipv4.conf.default.log_martians=1
cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: Update your kernel parameters to match - for each of these lines enter:

cdf12:Group.cdf12:title: Audit Strategy
cdf12:Group.cdf12:description: Audit strategy is highly environment and application specific. In the near future, we will post some overall best practices here, likey including a more standardized configuration for /etc/audit/auditd.conf

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Auditing is Enabled During Booting
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: auditd is great, but it can't audit processes that run before it starts - or can it?

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:p: Then modify the following line to read:

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Audit Rules are in Place
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Rules for auditd have been added for: date/time; user/passwords; networking; selinux; login & logout; permission modifications; unauthorized access; filesytem mounts; file deletion; changes to sysadmin scope; and kernel loading.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code:
# Date/time: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -k time-change -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S clock_settime -k time-change -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S clock_settime -k time-change -w /etc/localtime -p wa -k time-change
# User/passwords: -w /etc/group -p wa -k identity -w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity -w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity -w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity -w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity
# Network stuff: -a exit,always -F arch=b64 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale -a exit,always -F arch=b32 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale -w /etc/issue -p wa -k system-locale -w /etc/issue.net -p wa -k system-locale -w /etc/hosts -p wa -k system-locale -w /etc/network -p wa -k system-locale
# SELinux (likely you're using AppArmor instead, but just in case you pull SELinux packages from Debian, best to have this already listed) -w /etc/selinux/ -p wa -k MAC-policy
# Login and logout: -w /var/log/faillog -p wa -k logins -w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins -w /var/log/tallylog -p wa -k logins
# Permission modifications: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod
# Unauthorized access: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EPERM -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access
# Collect filesystem mounts: -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S mount -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k mounts -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S mount -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k mounts
# File deletion: -a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete -a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S unlink -S unlinkat -S rename -S renameat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k delete
# Change to sysadmin scope: -w /etc/sudoers -p wa -k scope
# Kernel loading: -w /sbin/insmod -p x -k modules -w /sbin/rmmod -p x -k modules -w /sbin/modprobe -p x -k modules -a always,exit arch=b64 -S init_module -S delete_module -k modules
# Make audit config immutable -e 2

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Ensure Only Root Can Modify System Cron Jobs
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Only root should modify what system jobs cron runs.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code:
chown root:root /etc/crontab chmod og-rwx /etc/crontab
chown root:root /etc/cron.hourly chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.hourly
chown root:root /etc/cron.daily chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.daily
chown root:root /etc/cron.weekly chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.weekly
chown root:root /etc/cron.monthly chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.monthly
chown root:root /etc/cron.d chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.d
/bin/rm /etc/at.deny touch /etc/cron.allow touch /etc/at.allow
chmod og-rwx /etc/cron.allow chmod og-rwx /etc/at.allow chown root:root /etc/cron.allow chown root:root /etc/at.allow

cdf12:Group.cdf12:title: Password Policy
cdf12:Group.cdf12:description: Script-kiddies and crackers should find no safe harbor here. Let's prevent common cracking by improving our password polcies.

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Password Policies Have Been Improved
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Password policies should be strengthened by: installing libpam-cracklib; strengthen password requirements; configure password lockouts; and configure password expiration.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code: # find "password requisite pam_cracklib.so retry=3 minlen=8 difok=3" # change to: password requisite pam_cracklib.so retry=3 minlen=24 dcredit=-2 ucredit=-2 ocredit=-2 lcredit=-2 # change next line to: password [success=1 default=ignore] pam_unix.so obscure use_authtok try_first_pass sha512 remember=5
auth required pam_tally2.so onerr=fail audit silent deny=5 unlock_time=900

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: SSH Configuration has been Secured
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: Modify sshd_config settings and permissions to be more secure.

cdf12:fixtext.xhtml:code: X11Forwarding no MaxAuthTries 4 PermitRootLogin no PermitEmptyPasswords no PermitUserEnvironment no Ciphers aes128-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes256-ctr ClientAliveInterval 600 ClientAliveCountMax 0

cdf12:Rule.cdf12:title: Banner is Added & Has Correct Permission
cdf12:Rule.cdf12:description: There should be a banner and it should have the correct permissions.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Insure that Virtualbox guest additions are up-to-date.

ind-def:variable_test.comment: Test that VirtualBox guest additions are the indicated version.

ind-def:variable_object.comment: The version number of installed VirtualBox guest additions

unix-def:file_object.comment: The directory containing the VirtualBox guest additions.

ind-def:variable_state.comment: The externally-supplied desired version of the VirtualBox guest additions.

unix-def:file_state.comment: Filter for the subdirectory of /opt containing the VirtualBox guest additions.

oval-def:external_variable.comment: The desired version of the VirtualBox guest additions.

oval-def:local_variable.comment: The VirtualBox guest additions version number.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Insure that Ubuntu is completely patched and updated

oval-def:criteria.comment: Verify that apt is properly configured, and that there are no updates.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Verify that apt is configured to use the desired repository.

x-linux-def:apt_test.comment: Verify that there are no updates available.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: Object representing all Debian binary package sources for apt.

x-linux-def:apt_object.comment: All updates available for installed packages.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_state.comment: Match against the externally sourced regex.

oval-def:external_variable.comment: A regular expression to match against all debian repository URIs.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Partition checks.
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Insure that variable-data partitions do not co-reside on the system partition's device, and insure that the proper mount options are set.

oval-def:criteria.comment: Check for both partitioning across devices, and mount options.

linux-def:partition_test.comment: The partition /run/shm does not reside on the same device as the root partition.
The partition /tmp does not reside on the same device as the root partition.
The partition /home does not reside on the same device as the root partition.
The partition /var does not reside on the same device as the root partition.
The partition /var/log/audit does not reside on the same device as the root partition.

ind-def:variable_test.comment: Check the mount options for the /run/shm partition.
Check the mount options for the /tmp partition.

ind-def:variable_object.comment: Mount options required for the /run/shm partition.
Mount options required for the /tmp partition.

linux-def:partition_state.comment: The partition does not reside on the root partition's device.

ind-def:variable_state.comment: Check that each mount option required for the /run/shm partition is found once among each of the partition's mount options.
Check that each mount option required for the /tmp partition is found once among each of the partition's mount options.

oval-def:local_variable.comment: The device on which the system partition resides.

oval-def:constant_variable.comment: Required mount options for the /run/shm partition.
Required mount options for the /tmp partition.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: /etc/modprobe.d/18fhardened.conf includes recommended hardening directives
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: The OS attack surface can be reduced by configuring modprobe to block uncommon file systems and protocols.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The modprobe configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Modprobe is configured to block installation of cramfs file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of freevxfs file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of jffs2 file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of hfs file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of hfsplus file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of squashfs file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of udf file systems
Modprobe is configured to block installation of the dccp protocol
Modprobe is configured to block installation of the sctp protocol
Modprobe is configured to block installation of the rds protocol
Modprobe is configured to block installation of the tipc protocol

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The content of the modprobe configuration file: '/etc/modprobe.d/18Fhardened.conf'

ind-def:textfilecontent54_state.comment: Matches the line: 'install cramfs /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install freevxfs /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install jffs2 /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install hfs /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install hfsplus /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install squashfs /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install udf /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install dccp /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install sctp /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install rds /bin/true'
Matches the line: 'install tipc /bin/true'

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Insure that the bootloader's configuration file has the proper permissions.
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Read/write access should be permitted only for the file's owner.

unix-def:file_test.comment: Check the file permissions of /boot/grub/grub.cfg

unix-def:file_state.comment: Group and other write/exec mode bits are unset.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: grub Has a Bootloader Password
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Protects booting by ensuring that grub has a password.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The grub configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: At least one superuser is defined in the grub configuration file.

ind-def:variable_test.comment: Each superuser has a password set.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The value that superusers is set to.
Users that have a password set.

ind-def:variable_state.comment: Each user that has a password set.

oval-def:local_variable.comment: Get each superuser by splitting superuser value on spaces, commas, semicolons, pipes, and ampersands
Users that have a password set

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Do not accept ICMP redirects
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This configuration prevents 'man in the middle' (MITM) attacks.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Do not accept IP source route packets
Log 'packets from Mars'
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: This logs spoofed as well as "source routed" and "redirect" packets.

unix-def:sysctl_test.comment: Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default filtering is set to true.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all filtering is set to true.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default accept_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all accept_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default secure_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all secure_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv6 default accept_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv6 all accept_redirects is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default send_redirects is set to true.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all send_redirects is set to true.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default accept_source_route is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all accept_source_route is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv6 default accept_source_route is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv6 all accept_source_route is set to false.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 default log_martians is set to true.
Check that the kernel parameter controlling IPv4 all log_martians is set to true.

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 RP default filtering kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 RP all filtering kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 default accept_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 all accept_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 default secure_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.secure_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 all secure_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.secure_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv6 default accept_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv6 all accept_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 default send_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.send_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 all send_redirects kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.send_redirects

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 default accept_source_route kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 all accept_source_route kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv6 default accept_source_route kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv6.conf.default.accept_source_route

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv6 all accept_source_route kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 default log_martians kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.default.log_martians

unix-def:sysctl_object.comment: The IPv4 all log_martians kernel property
unix-def:sysctl_object.unix-def:name: net.ipv4.conf.all.log_martians

unix-def:sysctl_state.comment: Assert that a boolean kernel configuration parameter is false.
Assert that a boolean kernel configuration parameter is true.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Grub is Configured to Enable Auditing During Booting
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Check to ensure that the grub configuration file includes a directive to enable auditing.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The grub configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: grub is configured to enable auditing on boot

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX directive setting in the grub configuration file: '/etc/default/grub'

ind-def:textfilecontent54_state.comment: Matches the line: 'GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX="audit=1"'

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Audit Rules are In Place
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Rules for auditd have been added for: date/time; user/passwords; networking; selinux; login & logout; permission modifications; unauthorized access; filesytem mounts; file deletion; changes to sysadmin scope; and kernel loading.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The auditd rules file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Date/time auditd rules are in place
User/passwords auditd rules are in place
Network auditd rules are in place
SELinux auditd rules are in place
Login and logout auditd rules are in place
Permission modification auditd rules are in place
Unauthorized access auditd rules are in place
Collect filesystem mounts auditd rules are in place
File deletion auditd rules are in place
Changes to sysadmin scope auditd rules are in place
Kernel loading auditd rules are in place
auditd config is immutable

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The content of the auditd rules file: '/etc/audit/audit.rules'

ind-def:textfilecontent54_state.comment: Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -k time-change'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S adjtimex -S settimeofday -S stime -k time-change'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S clock_settime -k time-change'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S clock_settime -k time-change'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/localtime -p wa -k time-change'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/group -p wa -k identity'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/passwd -p wa -k identity'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/gshadow -p wa -k identity'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/shadow -p wa -k identity'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/security/opasswd -p wa -k identity'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a exit,always -F arch=b64 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a exit,always -F arch=b32 -S sethostname -S setdomainname -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/issue -p wa -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/issue.net -p wa -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/hosts -p wa -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/network -p wa -k system-locale'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /etc/selinux/ -p wa -k MAC-policy'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /var/log/faillog -p wa -k logins'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /var/log/lastlog -p wa -k logins'
Matches the auditd rule: '-w /var/log/tallylog -p wa -k logins'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chmod -S fchmod -S fchmodat -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S chown -S fchown -S fchownat -S lchown -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b32 -S setxattr -S lsetxattr -S fsetxattr -S removexattr -S lremovexattr -S fremovexattr -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k perm_mod'
Matches the auditd rule: '-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S creat -S open -S openat -S truncate -S ftruncate -F exit=-EACCES -F auid>=500 -F auid!=4294967295 -k access'

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Ensure Only Root Can Modify System Cron Jobs
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Only root should modify what system jobs cron runs.

unix-def:file_test.comment: '/etc/crontab' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.hourly' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.daily' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.weekly' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.monthly' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.d' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/cron.allow' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.
'/etc/at.allow' should be owned by root:root and non-owners should have no access permissions.

unix-def:file_state.comment: File is owned by root:root; group and other read/write/exec mode bits are unset.

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Password Policies Have Been Improved
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Password policies should be strengthened by: installing libpam-cracklib; strengthen password requirements; configure password lockouts; and configure password expiration.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The PAM cracklib configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: PAM cracklib implements the prescribed retry, length and complexity settings.
PAM cracklib implements the prescribed password rotation settings.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The Login PAM configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: The Login PAM implements prescribed lockouts.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The Shadow Password Suite configuration configuration file exists.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: The Shadow Password Suite's 'PASS_MAX_DAYS' configuration value is 90.
The Shadow Password Suite's 'PASS_MIN_DAYS' configuration value is 7.
The Shadow Password Suite's 'PASS_WARN_AGE' configuration value is 10.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The PAM cracklib password retry, length and complexity settings.
The PAM cracklib password rotation setting.
The Login PAM lockout settings.

unix-def:file_object.comment: The Shadow Password Suite configuration file: '/etc/login.defs'

ind-def:textfilecontent54_object.comment: The Shadow Password Suite 'PASS_MAX_DAYS' configuration value.
The Shadow Password Suite 'PASS_MIN_DAYS' configuration value.
The Shadow Password Suite 'PASS_WARN_AGE' configuration value.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_state.comment: Matches the value: 'retry=3'
Matches the value: 'minlen=24'
Matches the value: 'dcredit=-2'
Matches the value: 'ucredit=-2'
Matches the value: 'ocredit=-2'
Matches the value: 'lcredit=-2'
Matches the value: 'lcredit=-2'
Matches the value: 'remember=5'
Matches the value: 'onerr=fail audit silent deny=5 unlock_time=900'
Equals '90'
Equals '7'
Equals '10'

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: SSH Configuration has been Secured
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: Modify sshd_config settings and permissions to be more secure.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The ssh configuration file exists, it's owned by root:root and permissions are set to 600.

ind-def:textfilecontent54_test.comment: The ssh 'X11Forwarding' setting is set to 'no'
The ssh 'MaxAuthTries' setting is set to '4'
The ssh 'PermitRootLogin' setting is set to 'no'
The ssh 'PermitEmptyPasswords' setting is set to 'no'
The ssh 'PermitUserEnvironment' setting is set to 'no'
The ssh 'Ciphers' setting is set to 'aes128-ctr,aes192-ctr,aes256-ctr'
The ssh 'ClientAliveInterval' setting is set to '600'
The ssh 'ClientAliveCountMax' setting is set to '0'

The content of the sshd_config setting 'MaxAuthTries'

The content of the sshd_config setting 'PermitUserEnvironment'
The content of the sshd_config setting 'Ciphers'
The content of the sshd_config setting 'ClientAliveInterval'
The content of the sshd_config setting 'ClientAliveCountMax'

Matches the value: '4'

oval-def:metadata.oval-def:title: Banner Exists & Has Correct Permission
oval-def:metadata.oval-def:description: There should be a banner and it should have 644 file permissions.

unix-def:file_test.comment: The Message of the Day configuration file has permissions set to 644 (rw- r-- r--).
The Login Banner configuration file has permissions set to 644 (rw- r-- r--).
The Telnet Login Banner configuration file has permissions set to 644 (rw- r-- r--).

unix-def:file_object.comment: The Message of the Day configuration file: '/etc/motd'
The Telnet Login Banner configuration file: '/etc/issue.net'
